Class LayoutContainerPanel2

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • LayoutContainerPanel2
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class LayoutContainerPanel2
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener
    This is the "asleep" view of the GUI. The gibbotTab images contain "public-friendly" descriptions of how the robot works. Only subpanel is a ChargingBox instance.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • allowDragging

        private boolean allowDragging
        True if top tab is pulled open (not visible). Allows user to pull top tab closed, since mouse-handling methods don't allow dragging past a certain point - to keep the end of the tab visible.

      • mouseAt

        private int mouseAt
        X-coordinate of where the user grabs a tab to move it

    • Method Detail

      • paintComponent

        public void paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Override of JComponent.paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics). super.paintComponent() call fills background color. Draws everything. This is what is executed whenever repaint() is called in the program. First fills entire space with a transparent gray background, then draws images. Uses boolean state variables to determine how to draw the gibbotTab images.
        Overrides:
        paintComponent in class javax.swing.JComponent
        Parameters:
        g - Graphics context for drawing. Kind of a black box; gets handled in the background somehow

      • resetTabs

        public void resetTabs()
        Called by GUILayeredPane when switching from asleep to awake mode. Resets all boolean state variables so that tabs are redrawn in original position the next time asleep mode is activated

      • mousePressed

        public void mousePressed(java.awt.event.MouseEvent evt)
        Called when the mouse is pressed (not clicked). Uses location of mouse at press event to set boolean state variables. User can press anywhere on a tab to start dragging it; however they can't move the middle tab if the top tab is pulled over it.
        Specified by:
        mousePressed in interface java.awt.event.MouseListener
        Parameters:
        evt - Used to get x, y coordinates of mouse press event

      • mouseDragged

        public void mouseDragged(java.awt.event.MouseEvent evt)
        Called continuously as the mouse is dragged. Only registers if one of the tabs is being pulled. Sets "pulling" state variables false if user pulls a tab past the right or left boundary, with the exception of when allowDragging is true, in which case the user is allowed to pull closed the top tab from rest in what would otherwise be "out of bounds" territory.
        Specified by:
        mouseDragged in interface java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener
        Parameters:
        evt - Used to get x, y coordinates of mouse press event

      • mouseReleased

        public void mouseReleased(java.awt.event.MouseEvent evt)
        Called when mouse is released. Only does something if user lets go of a tab before they have fully pulled it open, in which case the tab is redrawn as closed
        Specified by:
        mouseReleased in interface java.awt.event.MouseListener
        Parameters:
        evt - Used to get x, y coordinates of mouse press event
